text: I've been searching for info on this too. No luck yet.
Hi, I am trying to use HubSpot api to send emails to my client. can I use my starter membership to call the rest api?

It looks like it! (attached image is from the `marketing/v3/emails` API endpoint)  - Link to this endpoint:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/reference/api/marketing/emails/marketing-emails>

From what I've seen, all of the API endpoints have this "Supported Products" section in the introductions to the APIs. You should be able to use these to figure out if a specific endpoint is available for your HubSpot account type.

Hi! I'm trying to find an endpoint that returns all emails and their status that  i have sent to a contact, but getting a bit lost in all the endpoints :face_with_spiral_eyes:. Does anyone know if there's such a thing and where I can find it? Thanks!
Hello, qq: Is it possible to `unbounce` an email address via the API? I've searched this channel and the documentation and not seeing a definitive answer either way. TIA!

Running into a very specific issue: I'm currently using HubSpot with a Salesforce integration. However, I'm experiencing some issues with Salesforce-linked HubSpot properties and differences in the Metadata vs. Export API. For example, I have some properties that I can see in the Metadata API for Contacts, like:

• `company_linkedin__c`  
• `created_by__c`  
• `salesforcelastsynctime`
However, when I try to reference these API names for CRM Export, HubSpot responds that the fields are invalid. What next steps can I take to debug this issue and/or provide a bug report?

I enabled re-enroll on my workflow to test, and I started getting 500 errors today. I tried creating a new workflow with no re-enroll, and I'm now getting 500 errors on that too. I wonder if I found a weird window yesterday during my testing where it was actually working for a change. They must be having some issues on that endpoint right now.
it seems like this isn’t current possible, ill go with a work around of sending one request at a time

I don’t have an answer for this but if I were to make an assumption, HubSpot doesn’t put weight in fax numbers. It’s a niche communication method and was probably overlooked in requirements 

I’m far from the source of truth, just thinking out loud

Hi,
can anyone please help me on this.
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1738729161929989>

Send an email to USERS or CONTACTS?
In the case of contacts, why not simply make a PATCH on the contact, and store the dynamic values in the contact properties used in the email?
